scenario_title: Single-Event IP Theft via Email Exfiltration

why.details: The insider aimed to sell proprietary information to competitors for personal financial gain.

how.description: Requested internal documents from colleagues via email, using pretext of project handoff.
how.procedure: Insider recruits or convinces colleagues to share credentials or delegate access under false pretenses.
observable_evidence: Evidence of credential sharing or delegation
how.impact: Provides additional internal access vectors and facilitates subsequent privileged actions.

how.description: Accessed internal shared drive containing sensitive design materials and credentials.
how.procedure: Perpetrator persuades resource administrators to grant elevated access via social engineering or approval requests.
observable_evidence: Approval emails or tickets granting elevated rights
how.impact: Acquisition of admin-level credentials enabling access to sensitive repositories.

how.description: Used company email client to forward source files and credentials to an external personal email address.
how.procedure: Download or collect sensitive files and transmit them outside controlled boundaries (e.g., to personal cloud or removable device).
observable_evidence: Bulk file read and copy events
Outbound email attachments to non-corporate domains
USB insertion or atypical file timestamp anomalies
how.impact: Loss of intellectual property, potential regulatory or legal exposure.
